data.title: NFL QB Philip Rivers to be Head football Coach at St. Michael Catholic High School
data.meta_description: St. Michael Catholic High school in Fairhope has announced NFL quarterback Philip Rivers will take over as the school’s head football coach. Rivers is familiar with the St. Michael. He has hosted several quarterback camps at the school over the past several years. Rivers is originally from Decatur, Alabama and attended Athens high school. He was the fourth overall pick of the San Diego Charges in the 2004 NFL Draft following a standout college career at North Carolina State University.
data.text:
St. Michael Catholic High school in Fairhope has announced NFL quarterback Philip Rivers will take over as the schoolâ€™s head football coach.

Rivers is familiar with the St. Michael. He has hosted several quarterback camps at the school over the past several years.

Rivers is originally from Decatur, Alabama and attended Athens high school. He was the fourth overall pick of the San Diego Charges in the 2004 NFL Draft following a standout college career at North Carolina State University.

Rivers played 16 years for the Chargers organization in San Diego and Los Angeles, before signing a one year deal worth $25 million this past offseason with the Indianapolis Colts for the 2020 season.

A long time visitor to the Gulf Coast and Baldwin County, Rivers said he and his wife have always loved Baldwin County.

Acting Athletic Director Paul Knapstein will serve as the Cardinals' coach this upcoming season.
